newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Swedish govt sees Sweden meeting EMU targets.
newsitem.headline: Swedish govt sees Sweden meeting EMU targets.

text.p: Sweden's government said on Tuesday further reinforcements were not needed in Sweden's budget to fulfil the convergence criteria of Europe's economic and monetary union (EMU) as public finances were continuously improving.
"The government's assessment is that Sweden will qualify for a membership of the EMU," the government said in its spring budget proposal, released on Tuesday.
In the budget the government reiterated that it was not considering membership of the European exchange rate mechanism (ERM).
"Price stability is the overall aim of the monetary policy," the government said.

"This direction of monetary and currency policy has worked well. The choice of which exchange rate policy Sweden should have in the future will depend on the decision of the parliament on a Swedish membership in the monetary union during autumn of 1997."
